ratings.comment: Simply the best

He isn't clear about any of the material he teaches, and he messes up all the time and says "ah well you know what i mean." I didn't learn anything, yet my TA was helpful. I took AP Calc BC in HS, but only got a 1 on the AP exam but the class is fairly easy, tests are kind of hard-just make sure you know how to do every type of problem in the HW

His lectures were extremely dull, and rarely helpful; I learned more from the TA and the textbook (A GOOD TA IS KEY). His tests can be a bit rough, so watch out. Do the practice exams. Homework was not graded in my section, but that's based on TA's decision, not professor. Final was not cumulative. This class was tough, but not unreasonable.
The content of this class is tough, but his exams are fair. His final is not cumulative and HW is not graded! Get a good TA, do all of the HW and practice exams.

Fairly average prof, spends a lot of time on proofs in lecture because he is fascinated by math but doesn't work out examples, and the questions he puts on the exams are often more difficult than the ones assigned as homework.  With a good TA you should be fine though
Lectures are generally boring.  He goes through proofs rather than going through examples.  The exams questions are much more difficult than the homework.  Would not recommend.

Enjoys proving everything in class, but fails to demonstrate how to do any of the homework problems. If you haven't taken calculus before, be prepared to teach yourself most of the material. Having a decent TA is a must because lectures do not help clear up confusion at all.
He's not good at teaching and is pretty boring. Sometimes he cracks funny jokes. If you can take a different prof, do it, it will be easier for you.

Lectures are boring. Tests are hard and very harshly graded (generous curve though. I got a D- on both midterms but they were curved to a C). Lots of self teaching involve. Would not recommend if you're not good at math.
Very dull and boring lectures. You'll spend most of your time on facebook or texting. The course is an easy B for anyone who took AP Calc AB, and it helps to have a good TA.

Passman is a nice guy. Lectures can get extremely long. Be careful, he doesn't always emphasize things you really need to know for the test! The homework isn't bad but the tests are very in depth questions so make sure you know everything backwards and forwards. Grading is fair, TAs grade but your grade is based on 2 midterms and a final.

Passman is kind of a funny guy. He loves his proofs and spends most of the classes on them. The only problem is that he never explains them clearly and he almost never gives examples of actually problems. Tests could be very difficult, outside tutoring was necessary as the TA was even less clear.

Passman is another reminder that UW Madison is focused on hiring researchers, not professors. His exams (the entire grade) are barely related to the homework, and often ask you to do things that are shown in a single example in class. Avoid at all costs. He is kinda funny, but lectures are terribly boring.
Passman is alright for this coruse which is not that hard. This course more depends on your TA as mine sucks. He is alright in explaning the materials but can be very boring

I've had 3 terms of algebra with him. He seems to have little respect for students based on his jokes and "acts" like he's so tough as to be unapproachable. Material-wise it isn't demanding enough, at all.I regret taking him as I'll have to retake it or self-study to really have a solid understanding.One of the final questions:compute a determinant

Don't get me wrong, the guy is nice, but his exams have nothing to do with the homework problems, and your entire grade is based on two midterms and final. The curve is pretty harsh, and if you have a bad TA like I did, then you're screwed for the rest of the course. Expect to do a lot of self-teaching.

I'm going to have to disagree with everyone else here. I found Passman to be an ineffective teacher.  We didn't cover nearly as much as we should have in the course and we went over trivial things way more than useful things.Doesn't write proofs in lecture, just a few scattered words on the board.  He is funny though, so I guess that's a good thing
He is a great professor! The class and subject are pretty difficult but he only makes you know what he covers in class.  So just make sure that you go to class and you will do fine.
Super easy class. Passman is a funny prof. A lot of jokes. No need to hand in homework. Grades based only on exams. Final is not cumulative and exams are very easy.

Awesome Professor. Probably the best math professor I have had at Madison yet! He has a rather dry sense of humor that makes the class enjoyable. Exams arn't too difficult just do the homework and go to class!
He is an excellent professor.  He only requires you to know what he covers in lectures so go to lectures and you won't have a problem.

He's a cute old man with a brooklyn accent, but he's kind of monotone. His pace is extremely slow because he basically goes through all the theorems involved to get to a formula, BUT DOESN'T EMPHASIZE THE FORMULA YOU NEED TO KNOW. I joined Math Tutorial and that really helped.

He looks like Santa Claus, especially when he wears a red shirt. This makes lectures even more entertaining. He frequently jokes during lecture which makes it more interesting.  Homework is not required but helpful for the weekly quizzes. The tests are do-able as long as you study. There are practice exams that are extremely helpful.

Going to lectures makes you feel like you know everything he makes everything very simple.  The only problem was his tests were RIDICULOUS.  They were so much harder than lecture material, and his grading breakdown is 100% of your grade is from 2 midterms and a final. No homework or discussion grade. Terrible! Passman is nice but his class sucks.

Explained things clearly and understood his lectures.  Homework was pretty easy.  Make sure you  have a TA who explains things step by step and in depth because Passman expects this on tests.  Seems like his tests were impossible sometimes because his assigned homework made it seem so easy until it was midterm time.
VERY well organized :) likes to throw in a few jokes.  homework is simple, but beware, the tests are difficult!

Great teacher. Really knows his stuff and takes his time in teaching the material. Would highly recommend Passman if you want to LEARN calculus. Exams may be a bit difficult, but that's only because this class requires regular outside work to maintain a healthy set of algebra skills.
Great lecturer, the homework's relatively easy. The exams are far more difficult, but manageable. You need a good TA for this class, so switch immediately if you don't have one.

I didnt go to any of the lectures after the first couple weeks because he just explains whats in the textbook. my TA was an idiot too. tests are graded very hard. if you are a good independent studier its an ok class though

I thought that this professor was just though, until I started talking to him. He's very much about you teaching yourself, and expects that you go to lecture pretty much knowing everything already. The key to this class is a good TA. I also felt like everything on the exam was just out of reach, and graded very tough. I would not recommend at all.
Ok I guess.  Exams are nothing like lectures or homework problems.

Great Calc instructor! He taught me everything about Integrals I shouldve learned in mat221. Very clear while teaching and is actually interesting to listen to. Needs some help on teaching physics problems but that is a minor issue.

i just love him! lectures can be pretty boring but very important! he generally follows the textbook's outline but uses a different method (which is better and easier to understand!) from time to time..if you wanna take math 222, take him! i changed profs 3 times before i found him and he's a keeper!

excellent professor!! class is fairly hard but his lectures are clear, he does good examples, and he is very helpful. homework assigned is very reasonable and doesnt get equated into final grade. tests were difficult but very fair and his curve is very nice at end of semester.

The class is not intended to be easy, of course, but he does a very good job of explaining the difficult material.  He shows proofs, but doesn't require knowledge of them on tests.  final was not cumulative.
A very good professor. He tries to be funny so lectures are not completely boring. Tests are very straight forward.

Hard class but great professor. Homework and quizes arent graded but u doing them is very good for you. Practice exams are available and usually exams are pretty reasonable but he usually throws in a trick question to really test you!
He is a really nice teacher, the tests are pretty easy as long as you know the material, like nothing tricky, and he makes lectures not so boring by joking around once in awhile.

I've taken this class 3 times and he has been (by far) the easiest professor I've had for this class. He is very clear when explaining stuff (and almost dumbs it down too much.) His exams are very tough (like all 222 exams) but if you do ALL OF YOUR HOMEWORK and study a lot before exams, you will pass the class no problem. Make sure u get a good TA
he's very clear. nice handwriting. loud, clear voice. funny!

Passman communicates the ideas very well and teaches right along with the text. 90% of your grade was the take-home final and take-home midterm.  More comments on returned proofs would've been nice, but you can always go to his office hours. Glad I took this class from him instead of the white-haird angel of mathematical death, Anatole Beck.
One of the best math professors at UW.  He goes at a pace that is easy to follow.  Stay awake, do your homework (which really isn't that much at all) and you will do fine.

he talks really slowly and sorta quiet....put me right to sleep half the time, not much HW and isnt worth anything...all you grade is based on 2 midterms and final...not very helpful when it comes to test prep, need to know a lot of equations to do well on tests...overall not an easy class

Great teacher. Explains material well, and as long as you know how to do the homework you'll do fine on the tests. Only 3 exams, each about a third of your grade. Lightens up lectures w/ odd math sense of humor. Much better than my last prof. Definitely a good choice.

Really nice guy, tries to keep the class awake by cracking jokes. Tests are definately doable but count for everything. FINAL IS NOT CUMMULATIVE! The homework is not much at all and it covers all that you need to know for his exams. Take him if you have the choice!
He teaches clearly and moves at a good pace.  Homeworks aren't much, and aren't any part of your grade.  Tests are doable but worth lots of points.
Fantastic Professor. Spoke with great clarity and moved at a relatively slow pace. The exams were not bad at all.
He's a cute, genuinely nice professor!  He takes his time explaining things and is always there to help.  Just be careful with his tests.  The homework is really easy, but the tests are not.
Passman is awesome.  He teaches slow and thorough enough for all to understand, and he's always cracking jokes.  Take him at all costs.
He reminds me of Santa Claus.He goes very slow and describes things great.His tests can be difficult.

He goes over the material extremely thoroughly, but also takes forever with it b/c he's so old.  It makes lectures pretty boring.  You only get 3 grades--two midterms and a final (no discussion grade).  The tests are easy to finish, but you can't make many mistakes b/c it adds up quick.
Tests are somewhat easy. Goes pretty slowly through book. Funny guy.
nice guy, tough tests and curves DO NOI reflect students performance, clear and teaches well, but not what he's looking for on exams
He explains math concepts very clearly and teaches at a pace that students can learn easily at.
Awesome prof. very clear, and teaches well.  Teaching style is very easy to understand
He is a good professor, but some of those curves were pretty harsh.  He is easy to understand, and seems like a nice guy.

Awesome guy.  Best math prof I've had here, and I've had many.  Explains well. Talks slow.  Tests are easy.  Nice guy.  Has overall appeal of Santa Claus with Christipher Walken drawl.  Good for large lectures.
pretty easy tests, but harsh curves sometimes
No Comments
real good teacher. easy to understand. his tests are problem-solving, not proofs.
easy to understand and uses subtle humor for those who pay attention
